page.title: 03The Miners Strike
page.content: From March 6th.1984 to March 6th.1985 there was the longest{coal mining {strike}ever.Our area was affected .The {N.C.B.}is the largest employer of men in the area so not only were the {miners}themselves involved but all members of the community _ traders of all sorts. The strike was about jobs and pit closures.It was an unhappy and violent time and caused much distress to many families. The social centre was the hub of all the{N.U.M.}activities from deployment of pickets to feeding miners families;dealing with money problems or the cutting of electrical supplies. A ladies committee was formed and they delt with the supply and distribution of food.240,042 meals were served at a cost of Â£20,097.The food was got from local traders,door to door collections etc.
